data.title: 以至少 50 个字回答问题
data.content: "Children's toys may have an age recommendation (i.e., the age that the toymaker thinks is appropriate). Do you think that it is a good idea to have an age recommendation on toys? Why or why not? Use examples from your personal experience and observations to support your position."
data.answer: I think it is compulsory to have an age recommendation on toys because age-range information can be important for safety when playing with toys. For example, when toys contain small parts that a baby could swallow. In these cases, it’s wise to follow the recommended age-range information. Kids in different periods have different requirements. For babies, play is all about interactions with you or other carers or family members. A baby will delight in simply being with you. Toddlers love to play with boxes, building blocks, containers, and clothing for dress-ups. Older children often like to solve problems and use their imagination. So it is necessary to class toys in regard to age. (113 words)
